page.title: 17Woodland 2
page.content: Where coniferous woodland was found it was often mixed with deciduous trees. This expands the number of habitats for birds & insects in particular & so benefits the area's ecology.The main coniferous tree species were European larch,Scot's pine,Norway spruce,Douglas fir & Corsican pine.These were mainly inplantations owned by the Forestry Commission.In the private manor gardens such as Marsden & Rencomb Manors more unusual conifers occured:Leyland cypress,cedar of Lebanon & western red cedar.Few conifers existed to the eastern side of the area but in several cases the farmers had planted lines of conifers to act as windbreaks protecting their crops.The benefits of conifers on the ecology are good protection &nesting sites for birds & squirrels' dreys which also feed on the cones.
